item.title: Orange Group confirms breach after hacker leaks company documents
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: A hacker claims to have stolen thousands of internal documents with user records and employee data after breaching the systems of Orange Group, a leading French telecommunications operator and digital service provider. [...]

item.title: OpenAI bans ChatGPT accounts used by North Korean hackers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: OpenAI says it blocked several North Korean hacking groups from using its ChatGPT platform to research future targets and find ways to hack into their networks. [...]

item.title: Russia warns financial sector of major IT service provider hack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Russia's National Coordination Center for Computer Incidents (NKTsKI) is warning organizations in the country's credit and financial sector about a breach at LANIT, a major Russian IT service and software provider. [...]

item.title: Microsoft tests ad-supported Office apps for Windows users
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has released ad-supported versions of its Office desktop apps, which have limited features but allow Windows users to edit their documents. [...]

item.title: Australia bans all Kaspersky products on government systems
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Australian government has banned all Kaspersky Lab products and web services from its systems and devices following an analysis that claims the company poses a significant security risk to the country. [...]

item.title: Botnet targets Basic Auth in Microsoft 365 password spray attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A massive botnet of over 130,000 compromised devices is conducting password-spray attacks against Microsoft 365 (M365) accounts worldwide, attempting to confirm credentials. [...]

item.title: North Korean hackers linked to $1.5 billion ByBit crypto heist
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Over the weekend, blockchain security companies and experts have linked North Korea's Lazarus hacking group to the theft of over $1.5 billion from cryptocurrency exchange Bybit. [...]

item.title: Exploits for unpatched Parallels Desktop flaw give root on Macs
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Two different exploits for an unpatched Parallels Desktop privilege elevation vulnerability have been publicly disclosed, allowing users to gain root access on impacted Mac devices. [...]

item.title: Google Cloud introduces quantum-safe digital signatures in KMS
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google Cloud has introduced quantum-safe digital signatures to its Cloud Key Management Service (Cloud KMS), making them available in preview. [...]

item.title: Beware: PayPal "New Address" feature abused to send phishing emails
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: An ongoing PayPal email scam exploits the platform's address settings to send fake purchase notifications, tricking users into granting remote access to scammers [...]

item.title: Fake CS2 tournament streams used to steal crypto, Steam accounts
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Threat actors are exploiting major Counter-Strike 2 (CS2) competitions, like IEM Katowice 2025 and PGL Cluj-Napoca 2025, to defraud gamers and steal their Steam accounts and cryptocurrency. [...]
